title: Visual Learning Course for Integrated Management Accounting Based on a Unified Framework: Strengthening Language Expression and Communication

context.prior_knowledge: Proficiency in basic accounting principles and financial statement comprehension, foundational language skills for business report writing and presentations
context.additional_context: A course focused on cultivating managerial accounting decision-making skills for current practitioners applicable to real-world work settings. Special emphasis is placed on improving communication abilities to convey financial data interpretations clearly and persuasively.

learning_goals: Develop the ability to systematically connect three core concepts—cost calculation, budgeting, and performance evaluation—using the "Bridge" methodology of an integrated framework, and explain them in clear language.
Cultivate the ability to analyze various managerial accounting scenarios with 80% or higher accuracy using a single formula and graph system, and write analysis results in report format.

Strengthen the ability to visualize and analyze financial data in real business environments through VR simulations, replicate strategic decision-making processes with 90% or higher accuracy, and present findings orally and via presentations.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
